results.title: Operavox
results.creator_credit: Bare Boards Production, Sianel 4 Cymru (S4C) (Channel 4 Wales), BBC Enterprises, BBC-TV, Christmas Film, Pizzaz Pictures, Glenn C. Holberton, Renat Zinnurov, John Cary, Sue Goffe, Naomi Jones, Mario Cavalli, Natalia Dabizha, Gary Hurst, Valeri Oganov, Barry Purves and Graham Ralph
results.brief_description: This television series from the United Kingdom combines traditional opera with various animation techniques. Contains six segments from the operas: Carmen, Barber of Seville, Turandot, Magic Flute, Rigoletto, Das Rheingold. Traditional puppet animation (by Natalia Dabizha) is used for the Barber of Seville (Rossini) applying a suitably comic tone to the excerpt. Mario Cavalli utilises live action footage, and then paints over the images for his animated segment from Carmen (Bizet). For Rigoletto (Verdi) the dark themes of the opera are ably evoked with stop action puppet animation by Barry J.C. Purves. Other animators include: Gary Hurst (Puccini’s Turandot), Valeri Oganov (Mozart’s The Magic Flute), and Graham Ralph (Wagner’s Das Rheingold). The musical performance is by the Welsh National Opera and features various singers in each segment. Barber of Seville: Donald Maxwell, Peter Bronder, Patricia Bardon (singers), Gareth Jones (conductor) ; Das Rheingold: Phillip Joll, Penelope Walker, Janice Watson (singers), David Seaman (conductor) ; Carmen: Jean Rigby, Adrian Thompson, Donald Maxwell (singers), Julian Smith (conductor) ; Turandot: Jane Eaglen, Edmund Barham, Janet Watson (singers), Wyn Davies (conductor) ; Rigletto: Jonathan Summers, Rosemary Joshua, Anthony Mee (singers), Wyn Davis (musical director) ; The Magic flute: Neill Archer, Alwyn Mellor, John Connell (singers), David Seaman (conductor). Some images of nudity and violence make this DVD unsuitable for young children.

results.title: Operative training
results.creator_credit: PA Management Consultants and Cygnet Films
results.brief_description: An illustration of the application of advanced training methods to increase productivity in industry and commerce. Various tests are made on suitability of a candidate whose skill and stamina are then built up to the required standard of an experienced operative.

results.title: Operation X-70
results.brief_description: A satire on “scientific” warfare in which the new X-70 gas is accidentally dropped on a friendly nation, creating a surprising mutation. Won Special Jury Prize, Cannes International Film Festival 1972. Etchings by Marc Ampe, Animation by Willy Verschelde. Includes voice-over by Leonard Cohen amongst others.

results.title: Operation Venus
results.creator_credit: Paramount Educational Services Division and Alvin Yudkoff
results.brief_description: This film documents one of the first telephone “hot-lines” for teenagers by teenagers concerning venereal disease. The message is “Trust us. Call us. We will help you with understanding, in confidence”. Emphasises the importance of being responsible, the value of being educated and the rewards of honesty.

results.title: Operation sprats
results.brief_description: Looks at the sprat fishing industry in England. Fishing and canning operations are described with emphasis on the introduction of mechanisation. Trawlers, working in pairs, use echo-sounding equipment to locate shoals but netting and pulling-in still require all hands on deck. Machines cope with cleaning, grading, smoking and tin-can production and sealing at the canning factory but dexterous hand labour is needed to fill the tin with correct quantities of fish.

results.title: Operation skilltest
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Australia. Army. Director of Army Recruiting, Peter Johnson and Robert Walker
results.brief_description: An army recruiting film showing something of the training for over 500 separate skills necessary to keep the Australian Army at peak efficiency and flexibility including truck driving, parachute packing and boat skills.

results.title: Operation post haste
results.creator_credit: Department of Postmaster-General, J.W. Hutchinson and John Fitzsimons
results.brief_description: Presents the Post Office’s new services to the public, including air mailing letters where it would speed delivery. Modern mail-handling machinery expedites the delivery of 200 million letters each year. By using the recommended standard size envelope and folding enclosures correctly, so that letters do not have to be handled manually, the public can help the Post Office to provide a speedy service.

results.title: Operation picul stick
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Richard Mason and Jack Rogers
results.brief_description: Dramatises the scope for improved methods in a typical small factory, showing how production can be improved by better safety measures and simple handling of equipment. New equipment is installed, methods improved and results achieved.

results.title: Operation phasmatid
results.creator_credit: State Electricity Commission of Victoria and Jim Hayes
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the fight waged against a plague of phasmatids, a destructive stick insect, which unchecked would have killed large areas of forest, leading to erosion in the catchment and reduced supply water for the hydro-electric power stations. Shows the planning of remedial action climaxing in an aerial attack by spraying from a helicopter.
